channel.title: How do I
channel.description: How do I edit the amount of XP someone gets for each hit they do on an NPC? Can someone give me a CTRL+F code, please. Oh, and for the record, I use the Testscape source.

item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Waffles!!, post:10, topic:148519”]If you find the fighttype that should be all the kid needs.[/quote]True.

And I just thought of something. If it’s on NPCs, look for the case for “First Click NPC”. (Case 155 in client.java.) There all of the attack on NPC stuff with EXP should be handled, even though the NPC dieing and health stuff are handled somewhere else.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

If you find the fighttype that should be all the kid needs.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Waffles!!, post:8, topic:148519”]No tele, I’m right.

[quote author=The General link=topic=203674.msg1796477#msg1796477 date=1191383723]
How do I edit the amount of XP someone gets for each hit they do on an NPC?[/quote]
I’m the only one who came close.[/quote]No you’re wrong. The fightType is if they’re using aggressive, controlled, stab, slash, etc. That has nothing to do with the EXP you get per hit (usually). But I realize that since I quit servers, that a possibly I forgot about that when you train on NPCs, you have to set your type to get the exp for that skill. If I’m not mistaken, then I’m sorry. But what I said was right, what you said was somewhat right, but not very helpful at all.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Wow. Everybody in this topic was wrong except j dog was partially correct.

I garuntee you the EXP you get for the action (attacking an object or NPC) is based on your level. It’s probably located in client.java as said, but goes like this: b[/b]. The quickest and easiest way to find out where to change it, would be to go the spot in your file that has to do with that NPC/object being attacked. For the object being attacked, just look for

case ID

With the ID being the object ID.

If it’s an NPC, look in NPCHandler.java(?). I haven’t really worked with that, so I’m not 100% sure.

If you have an EXP Handler, check in that.

Hope I helped.

Read full topic

ok, that easy in cilent.java serach for the dummy or whtever gets exp and make the exp number a higher number

if its 45934 make it 70000 like that hope i helped

item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @King_Tom King Tom
item.description:
@King_Tom wrote:

Hit an NPC once, then check how much exp you got. Then I think you Ctrl + F that into notepad and change it to what you want. I think thats how.

Hope I helped

Read full topic
